results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Pauline Spiering

results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Libby Lloyd
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.
results.title_for_label: If you are not part of the solution…you are part of the problem

results.title: I think it's going to rain today
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joan Hobson
results.brief_description: The icy winter storm of abuse that a 14 year-old boy can bring upon a family. The unleashing of anger to deliberate acts of violence. Summer will come again but it will just take awhile.
results.title_for_label: I think it’s going to rain today
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joan Hobson

results.title: Finding me
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers
results.brief_description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers
results.description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.

results.title: Warriors and dancers
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narjiic Day-Burns
results.brief_description:
Narjiic’s passion for music and dance began in Year 10 when he was asked to perform for NAIDOC Week. From there he joined various dance groups performing all over Victoria including his home town Echuca, finally enrolling at Swinburne. Today he blends a fusion of traditional dance with hip-hop as a way of expressing his thoughts and emotions. Dance has become a part of his life.
Music by Fonetik.
results.description:
Narjiic’s passion for music and dance began in Year 10 when he was asked to perform for NAIDOC Week. From there he joined various dance groups performing all over Victoria including his home town Echuca, finally enrolling at Swinburne. Today he blends a fusion of traditional dance with hip-hop as a way of expressing his thoughts and emotions. Dance has become a part of his life.
Music by Fonetik.
description_for_label:
Narjiic’s passion for music and dance began in Year 10 when he was asked to perform for NAIDOC Week. From there he joined various dance groups performing all over Victoria including his home town Echuca, finally enrolling at Swinburne. Today he blends a fusion of traditional dance with hip-hop as a way of expressing his thoughts and emotions. Dance has become a part of his life.
Music by Fonetik.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.
